member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3
member.summary: Identifies the type of DXGI adapter.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3.DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3_REMOTE
member.summary: Value always set to 0. This flag is reserved.

summary.para: Specifies a software adapter. For more info about this flag, see new info in Windows 8 about enumerating adapters.
Direct3D 11: This enumeration value is supported starting with Windows 8.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3.DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3_ACG_COMPATIBLE
member.summary: Specifies that the adapter's driver has been confirmed to work in an OS process where Arbitrary Code Guard (ACG) is enabled (i.e. dynamic code generation is disallowed).

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3.DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3_SUPPORT_MONITORED_FENCES
member.summary: Specifies that the adapter supports monitored fences. These adapters support the and functions.

summary.para: Specifies that the adapter supports non-monitored fences. These adapters support the function together with the flag.
summary.div: Note For adapters that support both monitored and non-monitored fences, non-monitored fences are only supported when created with the and D3D12_FENCE_FLAG_SHARED_CROSS_ADAPTER flags. Monitored fences should always be used by supporting adapters unless communicating with an adapter that only supports non-monitored fences.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3.DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3_KEYED_MUTEX_CONFORMANCE
member.summary: Specifies that the adapter claims keyed mutex conformance. This signals a stronger guarantee that the interface behaves correctly.

member.name: DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3.DXGI_ADAPTER_FLAG3_FORCE_DWORD
member.summary: Forces this enumeration to compile to 32 bits in size. Without this value, some compilers would allow this enumeration to compile to a size other than 32 bits. This value is not used.
